AbstractText.sentence: The eukaryotic transcription factor NF-kappa B is involved in the inducible expression of various inflammatory genes as well as in HIV-1 replication.

AbstractText.sentence: Activation of NF-kappa B is induced by prooxidants and several stimuli eliciting oxidative stress, such as cytokines, lipopolysaccharide, UV irradiation and other mediators.

AbstractText.sentence: In this study, we have investigated the effects of selenium, an integral component of glutathione peroxidase (GPX), on NF-kappa B activation.

event.clue: In this study, we have investigated the effects of selenium, an integral component of glutathione peroxidase (GPX), on NF-kappa B activation.

AbstractText.sentence: In selenium-deprived Jurkat and ESb-L T lymphocytes, supplementation of selenium led to a substantial increase of GPX activity.

event.clue: In selenium-deprived Jurkat and ESb-L T lymphocytes, supplementation of selenium led to a substantial increase of GPX activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Analysis of DNA binding revealed that NF-kappa B activation in response to TNF was significantly inhibited under these conditions.

event.clue: Analysis of DNA binding revealed that NF-kappa B activation in response to TNF was significantly inhibited under these conditions.

AbstractText.sentence: Likewise, reporter gene assays using luciferase constructs driven by the HIV-1 long terminal repeat showed a dose-dependent inhibition of NF-kappa B controlled gene expression by selenium.

event.clue: Likewise, reporter gene assays using luciferase constructs driven by the HIV-1 long terminal repeat showed a dose-dependent inhibition of NF-kappa B controlled gene expression by selenium.

AbstractText.sentence: The effects of selenium were specific for NF-kappa B, since the activity of the transcription factor AP-1 was not suppressed.

event.clue: The effects of selenium were specific for NF-kappa B, since the activity of the transcription factor AP-1 was not suppressed.

AbstractText.sentence: These data suggest that selenium supplementation may be used to modulate the expression of NF-kappa B target genes and HIV-1.
